snippet: The estimated cost of rebuilding the World Trade Center has grown to at least $14.8 billion, up from $11 billion in 2008, according to an audit commissioned by the bistate agency.
abstract: Audit of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey shows that the estimated cost of rebuilding the World Trade Center has grown to at least $14.8 billion, up from $11 billion in 2008; audit finds the authority to be plagued by poor management that has obscured its exposure to billions of dollars in additional project and labor costs, and recommends a drastic overhaul of the agency's management structure.
lead_paragraph: The estimated cost of rebuilding the World Trade Center has grown to at least $14.8 billion, up from $11 billion in 2008, according to an audit commissioned by the bistate agency.
